section.name: Overview
section.p: Onotify is an OCaml binding for the Linux Inotify framework.
This project is a fork of ocaml-inotify, another Inotify OCaml binding initiated by Vincent Hanquez which can be found here.
Yet, Onotify is heavily based on this initial project and I would like to thank Vincent Hanquez for his work.
The essential differences between Onotify and the initial project are :

ul.li: a new build system based on OCamlbuild, GNU make and a shell script ;
the drop of the Inotify compatibility header (yet still present under unused/)

section.name: Keep informed about Onotify new releases
section.p: You can keep informed about Onotify new releases or major announcements by using the News System on OCamlForge.

section.name: Reporting bugs
section.p: You can report bugs through the Bug Tracking System on OCamlForge. Before submitting a bug report, please take the time to check if a similar bug report has not previously been posted on the Bug Tracking System.

section.name: Contribution
section.p: You can contribute to Onotify by submitting patches on the Patch Tracking System on OCamlForge. Or you can use the devel mailing-list.

section.name: Technical support
section.p: You can ask for technical support on the Tech. Support System on OCamlForge or on the devel mailing-list.
